Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: EALILALAGAN M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i stayed on the 12/03/2012 and on the 14/03/2012 till 15/03/2012 in different rooms, the stairways at both astoria or belmont was narrow, definitly difficult for moving up and down and even difficult moving up or down with heavy or bulky luggages, bathrooms small and bathroom not well designed for bath water to flow out . the location of this hotel was nearby padington station and walking distance to lancaster tube station, there's a plenty of cafe's and restaurant to cater food around this hotel, reception was manned by very friendly and very helpful staffs.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: girlygash Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i would like to say this hotel is brilliant for location only across and down the road from paddington train station and then only a short distance walk to oxford street. the room was ok myself and my daughter had a laugh about the size of the bathroom (its a french plastic shell bathroom so you can sit on toilet wash hands and have a shower all at once) but it was ok for us. the room was ok sheets clean. tv could only get two channels , the breakfast could have all cooked toast cereal just needed a few more cereal choices. the only thing was around 5.30 am you had a gentleman singing/saying prays which woke us up and then again at around 7 am . i would stay here again . the staff were very polite and friendly tubes are close by i thought it made the trip as you were in the heart of multi cultral area/ people

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fredrika S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great breakfast; as much toast you can eat, egg, bacon and beans. the only thing, the coffee looked like tea and had no taste nice but small rooms. we also borrowed an adapter at the reception. great location, walking distance to oxford street (10 min). and the area felt safe for 2 girls walking home after dark. I'll book this hotel for my next trip to London!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay cheap and at a good location, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There are two things that are good with this B & B; the location and their english breakfast. Paddington is a favorite place to stay in London. All the B & B have about the same standard and prices are about the same too. But Belmont offers english breakfast while most others only continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “It could be worse...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheapest hotels we could find because we didnÂ´t want to spend a lot of money. The room was very small with very old furniture but it was clean. The beds were ok. Breakfast was included: full english breakfast (beans, bacon, egg and sausage) , orange juice (not natural) coffee, toasts, jam and butter. It's really close to paddington station and you get to oxford street in a 7-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: I R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No internet in the rooms (only in the hotel reception lobby). Very good breakfast. Very nice and helpful staff! They turn off heating during the night! :( Small bathroom! Close to Edgware Road underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there it's awful”
Reviews.Author: Brenda G
Reviews.Content: No central heating so freezing said would fix it but didn't, no remote for TV.no hairdryer, had to ask for these, shower just no pressure and cold, hot tap in bathroom ran cold and visa vera!Don't use room 31 in the Astoria side you have no working phone too! Plus you have to come outside in the street to go into the Belmont Basement for breakfast and if you like a plate full of baked beans and not much else you'll be fine. We used room 32 to showeri but still no central heating and no refund so don't be a fool and pay in advance like me Brenda

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: dipdog
Reviews.Content: we travelled as four girls not wanting to spend too much on accomodation but to experience londons sights. we arrived at tea time and were a bit worried to be sent next door with our own key for the front door but was very pleasantly surprised. the rooin was spacious, the beds lovely clean and comfy with a big tv and tea making facilities. we were all in the same room, with four beds and the only thing i could say was that the bathroom was just a bit too small. the staff were lovely, the reception guy very polite and the breakfast very tasty. what more could you want for the price? ths was the third time we had travelled together and by far the best hotel for our budget. if we go to london again this is definately were we will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location nice room Very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: liam t
Reviews.Content: As the reviews go down the line i was not expectin much but when we arrive at the hotel was warmly welcome by the receptionist he checked us in as there were no potter service he if he could take the luggage into our room which was very kind. overall nice hotel, great location just minutes away from paddingtion station, full english breakfast excellent service. will visit your hotel again Liam Thorley

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: emma t
Reviews.Content: When we first booked this hotel, we did not read much of the reviews and didn't think much of it. Then a few hours before the flight, I started googling and read all these terrible reviews about how the hotel had bedbugs, ants, how you couldn't lock the doors, unfriendly staff, dirty rooms and bedding and no clean towels. After reading this, it was already too late to cancel the booking and we did not want to waste any money so we took a risk and went there. All of these staements however were false. We had three travellers, but we got a bedroom with four beds, that was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The bedding was clean and so were the towels. The bathroom was also spacious and clean aswell. The shower and toilet were fully in function. No problems at all. The breakfast was also good, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were cleaned once a day. We recommend this hotel to anybody who doesn't want to waste too much money for accomodation and doesn't need such a luxurious and top of the line hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst excuse of a hotel ever.!”
Reviews.Author: Winstonbulldog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this "hotel" in August 2011.. Worst excuse for a hotel that I've ever seen.. It's more like a bail hostel.. Staff speak no English, it's basically three terraced houses mackled together to make a "hotel".. Reception isn't manned, which meant waiting 30mins to check in.. Rooms are disgusting, small and in need of serious refurbishment.. Hotel was noisy, guests swearing shouting fighting and also noise from a nearby mosque all night.. Bed uncomfortable and was bitten all over by fleas when woke up.! Tea and coffee facilities were a joke, dirty mouldy cups only a person wanting to contract some form of disease would have drunk from these..! Exposed wiring in bathroom, taps had wrong colour on them.. I scolded my hand when I turned on the cold tap expecting cold water to come out..! Staff were useless.. Breakfast was nice but didn't in anyway make up for the most shocking hotel I have ever stayed at.. Put in a complaint and still no reply one month on.! Please don't waste your money, it's dirty, horrible and I didn't feel safe staying here.. 0/10..

Reviews.Title: “A health and safety nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Enjoytravel42
Reviews.Content: Room cramped, limited storage, worn and tired. Curtains hanging off and don't cover windows/doors, lights not working, doors not fitting, NO LOCKS ACCESSING BALCONY - VERY DANGEROUS, excessive noise due to traffic, shower head support broken, no hot water after 9 am, no thermostatic control on shower - VERY DANGEROUS ESPECIALLY WITH CHILDREN, no water pressure in sink, leak from toilet, noise from water pipes during night, fire exit was main door, no other exit and no evacuation map, FIRE ALARM WENT OFF 3 TIMES OVER 2 DAYS but no way of knowing whether it was genuine and no-one evacuated - twice was at 6.30 am, loud, swearing resident (who seemed to be a permanent resident) present at breakfast, breakfast space limited and choice limited

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Comfortable, Suitable for short stay”
Reviews.Author: wellexplored
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed for two nights, only issue we had was lack of hot water and a small ant problem (that we sorted out out) The hot water would be my only major complaint, But for two nights somewere to sleep and dump our bags while exploring London, it was brilliant, Id happly stay again for any weekend visit to London!!!!! Its low cost good for anyone on a buget and just wants a room to sleep in over night.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, small rooms, cheap”
Reviews.Author: MickeMex
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. There was no problem changing to twin beds instead of double beds. The breakfast was a good full English one served by a nice and friendly staff. Dining room quite small - must be troubleful if the hotel is fully booked. Room cleaning was not the kind you write home about... A short 5 minute walk to Paddington Underground station. The whole premise needs a refurbishment!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great value, friendly staff, beautiful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 6079max
Reviews.Content: We could not believe how well located this property was. It was just around the corner from Paddington station, which is a great link to all locations in London. The room was small, but clean and had a separate toilet and shower, which was a good idea. We had a beautiful breakfast included and it was such great value. The reception is open 24 hours, which was great for us as we were checking out early. Just a short walk to Hyde Park, which we walked through to Central London one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Aireli
Reviews.Content: I used an online booking website that didn't give out the names of the hotel until after I had purchased it. According to the website, I was booking a 3-star hotel in the Bayswater area of London. The only thing the website got right was the fact this hotel is in Bayswater, but is by no means a 3-star hotel. Upon arrival, my friend and I had to wait to check in because the door to the front desk was locked and there was no way of contacting someone to let them know we had arrived. The room was... clean. Furniture and bedding was mismatched, though everything was worn and could definitely be replaced. The bathroom looked clean, but smelled rank (as though there was a vent to the sewer somewhere nearby). I would have considered staying here had it not been for the fact the windows had no locks. As this was a ground floor hotel room facing the street, it would have been easy for someone to lift the window and climb through (since the windows had no screens and have quite a large opening). I wouldn't recommend this "hotel" to anyone. The fact that the windows didn't have any locks is reason enough. I would spend a bit more for a nice hotel (which is what I did once I was refunded due to the "unsafe" environment).

Reviews.Title: “Need to replace duvets”
Reviews.Author: RoverMidlands
Reviews.Content: Our room was at the front of hotel. If you have trouble sleeping because of noisy traffic, take ear plugs. Staff were friendly and breakfast was good. Downside - the duvets were very dirty and need to be thrown away and replaced with new ones. PLACE A FLANNEL OR SOMETHING YOU CAN STAND ON in the shower as the base lifts in the middle - I nearly had what could have been a nasty fall. Keep the shower/toilet door shut to keep out smell. On a positive note we would not be put off staying again, price was right and excellent location for all the usual tourist things. ps take your own toiletries as only provided small piece of soap.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Worn”
Reviews.Author: ADAGRIFF
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel having read a lot of the reviews on this site, and expecting things to be not too good. The receptionist was very polite and helpful, although there were several occassions when it was locked up and he couldn't be located. The room was smal,l but acceptable, although the decor and furniture were quite dated. The small portable TV was manually operated (no remote), and the portable aerial was secured to the side of the wardrobe with a band aid - no freeview. The bathroom was small but everything worked, except that you could not get any hot water for a shower in the afternoon. The reception informed us that there was plenty in the morning, but once used, it took most of the day to warm up again.The hotel was full during our weekend stay which is possibly why so much hot water used. The breakfast was delicious - full English - served by foreign staff, with a smile. The hotel was in a good location for Hyde Park, with Paddington and Edgeware Road stations only 5 mins walk. Overall a budget price paid for a budget hotel. No complaints, but 2 days was long enough due to small room sizes.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: theseaworker
Reviews.Content: Tiny modular caravan type bathroom, noisy, windows don't close properly, curtains ragged and don't close. Rooms poorly equipped, old and worn. bedsheets don't fit Reception service poor, and mostly unmanned and locked. Towels only changed after persistent requests. Breakfast good, staff friendly and helpful. Competativey priced Good location

Reviews.Title: “Worst and a very bad experience staying in a hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeManuel
Reviews.Content: WARNING, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. It was to my suprise that it was the worst ever hotel i ever stayed in! First of all the room is dingy,smelly and dirty.The toilet was extremely small, smaller than an airplane's toilet and my goodness it STANK!.But worst of all on the first night,i was about to go to bed and i found bedbugs crawling all over the bed! For those who do not know what they are, they are dirty little creatures who sucks your blood in the middle of the night and would multiply everywhere you go. It is a horrendous place. When we went to the receptionist to change our rooms, he was extremely rude to us. He kept on arguing with us and did not treat us customers how we should be treated. Considering the amount of money we paid for this hotel, he treated us as if we were staying there for free! It was such a horrible horrible place. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “A questionable choice”
Reviews.Author: London1300
Reviews.Content: Positive feedbacks: The hotel is located about 7 minutes from the Paddington underground and railway station, which is very practical. The area is quite nice and pleasant: there are a few Indian restaurants and pubs near by where good food is served. The staff at the reception was polite and helpful. As for the breakfast staff, even though some seem to only speak a few words of English, was friendly and polite as well. Negative feedbacks: The room I was in was extremely tiny - as a matter of fact, the only thing that could fit in the room was a single bed, a tiny (and dirty) sink, a TV (which did not work properly) and my luggage, which I couldn't lay down due to the lack of space. I could have live with the lack of space if the room would have been clean, which sadly, was not the case. Everything was old, tired looking and dirty. It seemed like the carpet hadn't been vacuumed in years and I doubt the sheets were even changed. Overall, the Belmont & Astoria Hotel reminded me more of a hostel than a hotel. It had a few good parts (friendly staff and location), but majors issues (cleanliness, room, etc.). Therefore, if you are looking for a comfortable and charming hotel, I strongly recommend staying in another place.

Reviews.Title: “xcellent value for money,no problems, friendly staff,excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: stamandas
Reviews.Content: just right for a great value trip to london. why pay more?. staff were friendly. location superb.room was small but clean, with fairly new ensuite shower room. Breakfast very good,full english, with as much cereal toast,tea and coffee as you wanted.....If you want five star luxury,then pay the price and stay elsewhere. But there is no need....Thankyou to all at the Belmont and Astoria....May see you again. We payed Â£59.00 for one night for the two of us! By the way ,Many thanks to the" Monkey Puzzle Tree" pub opposite. Quiete candelite place, providing good value home cooking. Visited them twice...Great.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but a good budget stay”
Reviews.Author: alikay61
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on here we travelled down to London with some trepidation and a "plan B" in case the room really was terrible. When we arrived we were greeted by a well mannered chap who checked us in, apologising that we would have to stay in a twin room as all the doubles were full. The room we found to be small but adequate, the decor was dated but perfectly inoffensive. The bathroom (again small) was clean but worn, although the shower worked well and was at least warm!! The heater in the room unfortunately could not be adjusted but there were sheets and duvets on the beds and spare blankets available too. The only thing missing from the room was a hairdryer unfortunately. The hotel was in a good location about 5 minutes walk from Paddington train and underground stations, lots of little shops and restaurants nearby including a 24-hour Budgens. The breakfast was delicious and included a full English all served with a smile. Overall a reasonable stay for the price, and very convenient for travel links. However I wouldn't personally like to stop longer than a couple of nights due to the small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Centerville
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Astoria for 1 night on July 16th. The reception was very polite and there were no problems with the reservation. We had booked a room for 4 and that is just what we got. The check-in is at 11:00 and we showed up about 12:30 and the room was not ready. We just left our bags and came back 1/2 hour later and it was ready. Going into this hotel we expected very little for the price and that is what we got but the room was clean and the shower worked great. Make sure you pack shampoo because they only supply a small bar of soap. The breakfast was served next door in the basement of the Belmont and it was suprisingly good. It would have cost our family of 4 close to 25 pounds to eat out but this was included in the 95 pound rate we booked through EasyToBook.com. The checkout was at 11:00 a.m. also but the reception allowed us to leave our bags so we could spend the day in London w/o lugging them around. The location is only about 3 blocks from Paddington train staion and tube which is great. There are plenty of places to eat w/in waking distance and the Cad bar just around the corner has probably the least expensive drinks in London. I would sugest that if you stay more than 1 night to find something better but for 1 night it works fine.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tediu
Reviews.Content: MAYBE IT'S A LONG DESCRIPTION, BUT PLEASE READ IT! THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD! The room was older then me. Needs a totally makeover. the curtains stays to fall. the double bed is one a half close to the wall so you won't fall off or because the room is so small. the ancient doors reminds me of the comunist east. the windows hardly open and they are also as old as the room is. the view is 3 1/2 walls and nothing else. the windows were not washed since the falling of the Berlin wall seams like. the furniture is falling apart, so i was afraid to use it. there was a water cooker and some coffe and milk, but the cooker was never cleaned inside i guess. and the 2 cups on the table you can still see the rest of the previous lipstick or coffe in it. the tv was small and dark, maybe because the dust is everywhere or because of the smoke before the smokink law. anyway, the only 5 chanels it's enough if you manage to switch on, because the remote control was broken and taped with tape so it bearly hold togeter. we got no shampoo, no shower gel, just 2 small pieces of soap of the lowest quality possible. we asked for shampoo, they dont have it. The bathroom was very small, you bearly manage to sit on the toilet seat because the sink it's right onto it. and the shower curtain is old and almost rotten. you can also see rust on the floor and door. well that was the room. The included breakfast it's no more then english breakfast wich is served along with a very small glass of orange juice and 4 toast for two . try and ask for more. the RUDE personell working there might give you more, but not be pleased that you asked for more. you can get coffer but only if you are there in time, half an hour before closing they stop cooking coffe so you might not get one. the cereals are on a table and nothing else. you get butter and the same 3 kinds of jam every day. i want to repeat myself so you can get the picture: The personell working in the breakfast room are RUDE! they don't smile, bearly say good morning or speak properly english, they get almost angry if you ask for something more or else to variate. They start cleaning the tables and remove the plates while you are still eating or holding your toast. maybe because right away they start cleaning the room and running to the next hotel? cleaning the room: you are asked to leave the room so they cand clean, they DON'T came again later. and about cleanig: they just fill for coffe and milk and arrange the bed. they dont change the sheets every day. we got new sheets because i insisted after 3 night. The ONLY positive thing was the all-right-one-smile personell at the reception. but no, they didn't have a map of the city and one evening at 9 pm we had to wait 10 min outside because it was closed. and this is a 24 hours reception hotel. All in all: expensive, dirty, rude stuff, no internet, not so great area and not good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Pay some extra pounds and choose a other hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junujon
Reviews.Content: Very small room. Sleep 4 nights on same sheets, get clean towles not until ask, twice. If you like bacon and beans.......after all don't choose this hotel. Pay some extra pounds and choose a other hotel

Reviews.Title: “Portaloo!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maz30
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked lovely on the outside, however when you get inside you are greeted by rather miserable looking staff who dont speak much and they dont even show you to your room. Upon entering the room after climbing a very narrow set of stairs, i was shocked to find the room so small that me and my mum could barely move, then there was the bathroom or lack of it i should say, it was the size of a small cupboard, i have seen portaloo's that are bigger, so if you are of a rather large stature i would avoid this place. Noisy, not very well decorated and tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff serving breakfast, really friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_Vera
Reviews.Content: My experience was generally good, rooms were clean, clean toilets sheets and towells, there was a cleaner keeping the room clean and tidy every day, the breakfast was reall nice, and the staff was really friendly. I donÂ´t know if the rooms in Belmont building are diferent, but I went to the astoria, allthough the main reception and breakfast was served in the belmont (itÂ´s the next door if you are in the astoria). The only reason I am not rating as an excelent is because of the receptionist that received me and my friends, the only staff member that wasnÂ´t friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “disgusted anglesey”
Reviews.Author: sirfon
Reviews.Content: stayed in the belmont part of this hotel , the photos for this must be from the astoria or another hotel. we booked for our visit to the hyde park calling concert. would rather have camped out in the park in the pouring rain. tiny rooms musty smell, with very narrow stairs leading down to the cellar I think!! when we woke in the morning hundreds of ants crawling all over the place coming in from a hole by the door and walking along the dado rail, did pass a comment to the staff but were not interested. couldn't get out of there fast enough. never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: mugginsDublin
Reviews.Content: I booked for one,received a quad room. Musty smell, Carpet certainly not clean would not be safe to walk on in bare feet.Shower tiny, ceiling covered in black spots over shower, power weak,just one tiny bar of "Soap" despite saying toiletries are provided. Hair dryer had to be collected at reception. This room was 50 steps up a narrow stairway next to attic. No assistance offered to bring case up or down. Sheets were white but I woke up "itching" Reception area had t.v. but couches had torn seating. Could not face breakfast having had a sleepless few hours. Certainly would not recommend this to anyone. This building should be checked for Health and Safety.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gammij
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beaten, within walking distance of Paddington Station and Hyde Park. Front desk is open 24 hours which helped when we checked in at midnight. We stayed in the Astoria which two doors away from the Belmont. Our quad had a small bath en suite. Room was clean and tidy. Tea and coffee provided in the room. Breakfast is served in the Belmont and was proper English fare. Room had little character and no pictures on the wall which was not important but noticible. Staff was helpful and friendly and very nice to our young children. I would return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TB_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: We were here for a one-night stay in June. This hotel is in a good location about 2 blocks from Paddington Station. The room was small (but not the smallest we have stayed at in London). However, the configuration of the furniture made it very difficult to find a place to put 2 small/medium suitcases where you could open them. The suitcases would either be where you wanted to walk or in front of the door. The room was clean and the bed fairly comfortable. There was a hot pot with tea bags and instant coffee in the room. We were in a ground floor room near the reception so it was a little noisy, but not too bad. Unfortunately the windows to the room did not open so it was a little stuffy but fine since we were so tired from our day. If it were very warm out, it would have been uncomfortable. Full English breakfast (sausage, ham, egg, beans, toast, coffee/tea, and juice) were included in the price and it was pretty good. They serve breakfast downstairs which keeps some of the noise away from the rooms. All of the staff were very nice and friendly. This is a fine hotel for a short stay, but may not be comfortable for a longer stay. But, the price was very reasonable for London (70 pounds per night) and for being so close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: one-romanian_artist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not at all as the photos from the website and from the internet! They have very small horrible rooms, with VERY narrow stairs, and the windows can't be opened! The furniture looks as from the communist schools, and believe me i know what i am talking about, because i am from an ex-communist country! They have no fridge as they say, no mirror as in the photos, the tv was not working, no towels when we checked in (we had a horible twin in the top of the building) and the guy from the reception charged me before seeing the room! Then he told is not his fault they are not towels, and the photos are different! He promised to give us another room,which he never did,and when i was asking him why happens all this,he simply played he doesn't hear! Finally, he changed the tv with one which was working. The only quality this hotel has was the position and that it was clean. Sussex Gardens street is full with hotels, so choose another. They are planty of them, all loooking better.

HotelInfo.Name: Belmont & Astoria Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: 100 & 104 Sussex Gardens, London W2 1UH , England
